item.title: Hope add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Children are a battle of a different sort. ... A battle without banners or warhorns but no less fierce." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Hope add a quote by Octavia Butler
item.description: "In order to rise From its own ashes A phoenix First Must Burn." -- Octavia Butler

item.title: Hope add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: Hope add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Human speech is like a cracked kettle on which we tap crude rhythms for bears to dance to, while we long to make music that will melt the stars." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Hope add a quote by Derek Landy
item.description:
"Are you going to shoot me?' Vengeous sneered. 'I wouldn't be surprised. What would a thing like you know about honor? Only a heathen would bring a gun to a sword fight.'
And only a moron would bring a sword to a gunfight." -- Derek Landy

item.title: Hope add a quote by Thomas Merton
item.description: "The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image." -- Thomas Merton

item.title: Hope add a quote by Vita Sackville-West
item.description: "Damn you, spoilt creature; I shan’t make you love me any the more by giving myself away like this." -- Vita Sackville-West

item.title: Hope add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Hope add a quote by George Plimpton
item.description: "I have never been convinced there's anything inherently wrong in having fun. " -- George Plimpton

item.title: Hope add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Hope add a quote by Rafael Sabatini
item.description: "He was born with a gift of laughter and a sense that the world was mad." -- Rafael Sabatini

item.title: Hope add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "Nobody ever figures out what life is all about, and it doesn't matter. Explore the world. Nearly everything is really interesting if you go into it deeply enough." -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: Hope add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "A book is really like a lover. It arranges itself in your life in a way that is beautiful." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Hope add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I am large, I contain multitudes" -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Hope add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "The conversation of kisses. Subtle, engrossing, fearless, transforming." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Hope add a quote by Kiran Desai
item.description: "The present changes the past. Looking back you do not find what you left behind." -- Kiran Desai

item.title: Hope add a quote by Jane Addams
item.description: "The good we secure for ourselves is precarious and uncertain until it is secured for all of us and incorporated into our common life." -- Jane Addams

item.title: Hope add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "For my part, I prefer my heart to be broken. It is so lovely, dawn-kaleidoscopic within the crack." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Hope add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "[Kids] don't remember what you try to teach them. They remember what you are." -- Jim Henson

item.title: Hope add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Hope add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Hope add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Hope add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Hope add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!" -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Hope add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Hope add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "I was not ladylike, nor was I manly. I was something else altogether. There were so many different ways to be beautiful." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Hope add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "we become the stories we tell ourselves" -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Hope add a quote by Astrid Lindgren
item.description: "Give the children love, more love and still more love – and the common sense will come by itself." -- Astrid Lindgren

item.title: Hope add a quote by Maeve Binchy
item.description: "I don't have ugly ducklings turning into swans in my stories. I have ugly ducklings turning into confident ducks." -- Maeve Binchy

item.title: Hope add a quote by Andrzej Sapkowski
item.description: "People," Geralt turned his head, "like to invent monsters and monstrosities. Then they seem less monstrous themselves. When they get blind-drunk, cheat, steal, beat their wives, starve an old woman, when they kill a trapped fox with an axe or riddle the last existing unicorn with arrows, they like to think that the Bane entering cottages at daybreak is more monstrous than they are. They feel better then. They find it easier to live." -- Andrzej Sapkowski
